title: How to Clean Pewter Naturally

steps.headline: Dissolve the salt in the vinegar.
Add enough flour to form a paste.
Rub the paste onto blackened pewter.
steps.description: Use a clean and soft cloth to rub in the paste.

steps.headline: Leave to dry.
steps.description: As the paste dries, it will continue to work its magic on the blackened pewter.

steps.headline: Rinse off with warm water.
steps.description: Dampen a clean and soft cloth in warm water and rub over the pewter to remove the paste.

steps.headline: Leave to dry.
steps.description: Wipe over with a paper towel for added sparkle.

text: Dissolve the salt in the vinegar.  Add enough flour to form a paste.  Rub the paste onto blackened pewter. Use a clean and soft cloth to rub in the paste. Leave to dry. As the paste dries, it will continue to work its magic on the blackened pewter. Rinse off with warm water. Dampen a clean and soft cloth in warm water and rub over the pewter to remove the paste. Leave to dry. Wipe over with a paper towel for added sparkle.
